    • Method Detail

      • getRecords

        public static javax.sql.rowset.CachedRowSet getRecords(java.lang.String table,
                                                       java.lang.String[] attributes,
                                                       java.util.Map whereStmts,
                                                       java.util.Map joinStmts)
        A generic method that builds a SELECT String from the parameters that is passed to it. This collapses every possible SELECT situation in the system into this one method.
        Parameters:
        table - The table that is wished to retrieve data from.
        attributes - A String Array with the attributes from the table that is wished returned. Enter 'null' if all attributes should be returned.
        whereStmts - A Map of Strings that contains the 'keys' and 'values' in the WHERE clause. e.g. "WHERE 'key' = 'value'". Leave 'null' if no WHERE clause is needed.
        joinStmts - A Map of Strings that contains 'keys' and 'values' in the JOIN clause. e.g. "JOIN key ON value". Leave 'null' if no JOIN clause is needed.
        Returns:
        Returns the data in a CachedRowSet.

      • appendAttributes

        private static java.lang.String appendAttributes(java.lang.String sql,
                                                 java.lang.String[] attributes,
                                                 java.lang.String table)
        This method is only used by getRecords() to build the first part of the SQL-statement. Is there no specific attributes wished to be returned, return all Else, it builds the attributes into the SQL-statement and returns it
        Parameters:
        sql - The current SQL-statement that is being build.
        attributes - A String Array with the attributes from the table that is wished returned. Enter 'null' if all attributes should be returned.
        table - The table that is wished to retrieve data from.
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the SQL-Statement, to the "FROM" clause.

      • joinOn

        private static java.lang.String joinOn(java.lang.String table,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> joins,
                                       java.lang.String sql)
        NOTE: IT IS UNUSED AND NOT WORKING. POSSIBLY REQUIRES FIXING IF A CLIENT IS IMPLEMENTED DIFFERENTLY THAN eva_client This metods is only used by getRecords() to build the second part of the SQL-statement. Is there no JOINs wished, this is ignored. Otherwise, it builds the "JOIN" clause on the SQL-Statement.
        Parameters:
        joins - A Map of Strings that contains 'keys' and 'values' in the JOIN clause. e.g. "JOIN key ON value". Leave 'null' if no JOIN clause is needed.
        sql - The current SQL-statement that is being build.
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the SQL-Statement, with the "JOIN" clause.

      • buildWhere

        private static java.lang.String buildWhere(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params,
                                           java.lang.String sql)
        This metods is only used by getRecords() to build the third part of the SQL-statement. Is there no "WHERE" clause wished, this is ignored. Otherwise, it builds the "WHERE" clause on the SQL-Statement.
        Parameters:
        params - A Map of Strings that contains the 'keys' and 'values' in the WHERE clause. e.g. "WHERE 'key' = 'value'". Leave 'null' if no WHERE clause is needed.
        sql - The current SQL-statement that is being build.
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the SQL-Statement, with the "WHERE" clause.

      • insertIntoRecords

        public static void insertIntoRecords(java.lang.String table,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        A generic method that builds a INSERT String from the parameters that is passed to it. This collapses every possible INSERT situation in the system into this one method.
        Parameters:
        table - The table that is wished to INSERT data into.
        values - A Map of Strings that contains 'keys' and 'values' in the INSERT clause. - "INSERT INTO (key) VALUES ("value")".
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • appendValues

        private static java.lang.String appendValues(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
        This method is only used by insertIntoRecords() to build the VALUES clause.
        Parameters:
        values - A Map of Strings that contains 'keys' and 'values' in the INSERT clause. - "INSERT INTO (key) VALUES ("value")".
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the SQL-Statement, with the "VALUES" clause.

      • updateRecords

        public static void updateRecords(java.lang.String table,
                                 java.util.Map fields,
                                 java.util.Map whereStmts)
        A generic method that builds a UPDATE String from the parameters that is passed to it. This collapses every possible UPDATE situation in the system into this one method.
        Parameters:
        table - The table that is wished to UPDATE data into.
        fields - A Map of Strings that contains 'keys' and 'values' in the UPDATE clause. - "SET 'key'='value'".
        whereStmts - A Map of Strings that contains the 'keys' and 'values' in the WHERE clause. e.g. "WHERE 'key' = 'value'". Leave 'null' if no WHERE clause is needed.

      • createUpdateSQLStmt

        private static java.lang.String createUpdateSQLStmt(java.lang.String sql,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fields)
        This method is only used by updateRecords() to build the SET clause.
        Parameters:
        sql - The current SQL-statement that is being build.
        fields - A Map of Strings that contains 'keys' and 'values' in the UPDATE clause. - "SET 'key'='value'".
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the SQL-Statement, with the "SET" clause.

      • deleteRecords

        public static void deleteRecords(java.lang.String table,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> whereStmts)
        A generic method that builds a DELETE String from the parameters that is passed to it. This collapses every possible DELETE situation in the system into this one method.
        Parameters:
        table - The table that is wished to UPDATE data into.
        whereStmts - A Map of Strings that contains the 'keys' and 'values' in the WHERE clause. e.g. "WHERE 'key' = 'value'". Leave 'null' if no WHERE clause is needed.
